CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper September 22, 1945, pg. 20, reads: "Smoky City Visitor - Mrs. Edward Bolling (seated, left) is shown with her Pittsburgh hostess, Mrs. John Butler, during the former's recent visit, when she and her well-known husband, principal of the Deaf, Dumb and Blind School in Institute, W. Va., spent time having fun in the East. With them was their handsome little nephew, Donald Jackson. - Courier Photo by Harris."
TitMainTitle: Mrs. Edward Bolling and Mrs. John Butler posed on floral sofa in Butler home with landscape painting and oriental rugs
